_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary, Risk Management Plan (RMP) fro Silver Eagle Refinery, Evanston, Wyoming, June 2004.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          This summary covers the Risk Management Plan (RMP) for Silver Eagle Refinery, Evanston, Wyoming.                                                                                                                                    Environmental and Safety Policies.                                                                                                                                                                                Silver Eagle Refinery is committed to the safety of its employees, visitors, and public in the operation of this facility.  Silver Eagle Refinery is also committed to the protection of the environment.  Procedures and plans (such as spill prevention plans, emegency response procedures,safe work procedures and operating procedures) have been implemented to help ensure the facility operates in a safe and environmentally friendly manner.

Facility Description:
Silver Eagle Refinery is a small Refinery located approximately six miles east of Evanston Wyoming.  The facility is located in a somewhat isolated area of Uinta County.  The closest residential population is over four miles away.  The facility processes mainly light crude oil into gasoline.  The facility can process between 3000 and 4000 barrels per day.  The facility was built in 1989 and operated until 1991.  It was shut down from 1991 t

o 1996.  Silver Eagle restarted the refinery and has operated it since 1996.

Materials handled at the Facility:
Silver Eagle processes light crude oil into gasoline.  As part of the refining process the facility produces, purchases and stores liquefied petroleum gas (LPG).  These gasses include methane, ethane, propane, butanes, and pentanes.  The other materials handled at this facilty include: light crude oil, gasoline, diesel,and residual fuel oil.  Gasoline is the largest volume material processed and stored at this facilty.





Release Prevention Steps:
Silver Eagle takes many steps to ensure releases are prevented as much as possible.  Some of these include adhering to numerous environmental and safety regulations.  Silver Eagle must comply with regulations such as Process Safety Management (PSM), Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasures (SPCC), the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA), EPA Right-to Know Laws and air emmissions regulations.  In addition, Silver Eagle uses guidelines and standards developed by the American Petroeum Institute (API) for safe design and operation of petroleum refineries. Refinery personnel are highly trained in safe operating practices.

Five Year Accident History:
Silver Eagle has operated this facility since 1996.  During that time, no accidental releases have occurred that left the facility boundaries or affected any offsite locations.

Emergency Response Program:
Silver Eagle's emergency response program consists of trained employees, coordination and notification of response agencies and specific response duties.  Silver Eagle's employees are routinely trained in emergency response measures such as fire fighting, spill response, handling of specific chemicals, evacuation measures and other specific measusres.  Am emergency response plan for Silver Eagle has been provided to local emergency response agencies.  Silver Eagle's emergency plan includes a list of chemicals and volumes of chemicals handled at the fac
ility, emergency phone numbers, evcacuation plans and how to contact local emergency respose agencies.  Silver Eagle keeps emergency response equipment and machinery availale for use as needed.
